executable.title: Diffusion Tensor Estimation Batchmake
executable.description: Performs a tensor model estimation from diffusion weighted images.There are three estimation methods available: least squares, weigthed least squares and non-linear estimation. The first method is the traditional method for tensor estimation and the fastest one. Weighted least squares takes into account the noise characteristics of the MRI images to weight the DWI samples used in the estimation based on its intensity magnitude. The last method is the more complex.
executable.acknowledgements: This command module is based on the estimation capabilities of teem

directory.name: dataDir
directory.description: Directory containing the diffusion-weighted image files in nrrd or nhdr format)
directory.label: Data directory
directory.description: Directory where to find input images

string.name: dataMask
string.description: Wildcard/mask to apply to the directory listing to select only the images to be processed
string.label: Data file mask

boolean.name: dataMaskRecursive
boolean.description: Automatically descend into subdirs to find input files
boolean.label: Recursive

directory.name: outputDir
directory.label: Output directory
directory.description: Directory where to put the processed images

string-enumeration.name: estimationMethod
string-enumeration.description: LS: Least Squares, WLS: Weighted Least Squares; NL: Nonlinear Control the accuracy of the tensor estimation (at the expense of computation time)
string-enumeration.label: Estimation Parameters

boolean.name: ShiftNegativeEigenvalues
boolean.description: Shift eigenvalues so all are positive (accounts for bad tensors related to noise or acquisition error)
boolean.label: Shift Negative Eigenvalues

double.name: otsuOmegaThreshold
double.label: Otsu Omega Threshold Parameter
double.description: Control the sharpness of the threshold in the Otsu computation. 0: lower threshold, 1: higher threhold

boolean.name: runUsingCondor
boolean.description: Select to run on local grid using Condor (BatchMake must have been compiled using Condor)
boolean.label: Run using Grid/Condor
